headline: Hormel Foods Once Again Recognized for Having Top Summer Internship Program
summary: Hormel Foods Corporation (NYSE: HRL), a Fortune 500 global branded food company, announced today that it was again recognized by Vault as having one of the top 150 internship programs in the nation. The company's multi-year, award-winning summer internship program was recognized in the categories of Best Internships for Consumer and Industrial Products; Engineering; as well as Sales, Marketing and Communications.

content.title: Hormel Foods Once Again Recognized for Having Top Summer Internship Program

thumbnail.caption: Hormel Foods Corporation, a Fortune 500 global branded food company, was recently recognized by Vault as having one of the top 150 internship programs in the nation.

headline: Hormel parts ways with CFO; warns of persistent inflation impacts
summary: Hormel controller Paul Kuehneman will take the interim chair as the branded food company warns against ongoing headwinds including food recalls and commodity inflation.

content.title: Hormel parts ways with CFO; warns of persistent inflation impacts
content.summary: Hormel controller Paul Kuehneman will take the interim chair as the branded food company warns against ongoing headwinds including food recalls and commodity inflation.

thumbnail.caption: Jars of Skippy peanut butter are displayed on a shelf at a store on November 2, 2015 in San Rafael, California.

headline: Hormel Foods announces planned retirement of PJ Connor, group vice president of Retail sales, following three decades of service and leadership
summary: Hormel Foods Corporation (NYSE: HRL), a Fortune 500 global branded food company, announced the planned upcoming retirement of PJ Connor, group vice president of Retail sales, to coincide with his 30-year anniversary with the company this spring. Throughout his career, Connor has guided the organization through multiple transformation initiatives, built high-performing teams and championed the growth and development of talent across the organization.

content.title: Hormel Foods announces planned retirement of PJ Connor, group vice president of Retail sales, following three decades of service and leadership

headline: Hormel Foods (HRL): Evaluating Valuation After CFO Change, Q4 Guidance Shift, and New Product Launches
summary: Hormel Foods (NYSE:HRL) is getting attention this week following the appointment of Paul Kuehneman as interim chief financial officer. This move comes as the company adjusts its Q4 2025 earnings outlook, manages a voluntary product recall, and introduces a new bacon collaboration. See our latest analysis for Hormel Foods. Hormel Foods’ year has been defined by product launches, strategic partnerships, and executive changes, but the market response has been tough. The stock’s 1-year total...
